title: Route errors to stderr
description:
**Problem:** Errors print to stdout, breaking JSON mode when errors mix with output.

**Solution:** Use Python sys.stderr for error messages.

**Locations:**
- cli.mojo: Error messages
- walker.mojo: 'Error accessing' message
- reranker.mojo: 'Failed to initialize' message

**Pattern:**
```mojo
var sys = Python.import_module("sys")
_ = sys.stderr.write("Error: ...\n")
```
close_reason: Fixed: error messages now use print(..., file=stderr)

title: Add --help flag
description:
**Problem:** No --help flag. Users must guess usage.

**Solution:** Add --help/-h flag with usage info.

```mojo
if "--help" in args or "-h" in args:
    print("Usage: hygrep <query> [path] [--json]")
    print("")
    print("Options:")
    print("  --json    Output structured JSON for agents")
    print("  --help    Show this help message")
    return
```

**Location:** cli.mojo (arg parsing section)
close_reason: Fixed: added --help/-h flag with usage info

title: Handle circular symlinks
description:
**Problem:** walker.mojo follows all directories. Circular symlinks cause infinite loop/stack overflow.

**Solution:** Track visited directories by their real path (resolved symlinks).

```mojo
var visited = Set[String]()
# In walk loop:
var real_path = String(full_path.resolve())
if real_path in visited:
    continue
visited.add(real_path)
```

**Location:** src/scanner/walker.mojo:hyper_scan()
close_reason: Fixed: added visited Set to track real paths

title: Add file size limit in scanner (skip >1MB)
description:
**Problem:** walker.mojo:42-51 reads entire file with no size limit. A 10GB log file will OOM.

**Solution:** Check file size before reading, skip files >1MB.

**Location:** src/scanner/walker.mojo:scan_file()

**Pattern (from stdlib):**
```mojo
# Check size before read
var stat = file.stat()
if stat.st_size > 1_000_000:
    return False
```

title: Initialize mask array to False
description:
**Problem:** walker.mojo:98 allocates mask without initialization.

```mojo
var mask = alloc[Bool](num_files)  # Not zeroed - undefined behavior
```

**Solution:** Initialize to False explicitly.

```mojo
var mask = alloc[Bool](num_files)
for i in range(num_files):
    mask[i] = False
```

**Location:** src/scanner/walker.mojo:98

title: Validate path exists before scanning
description:
**Problem:** cli.mojo:32 creates Path without validation. Invalid paths produce cryptic errors.

**Solution:** Check path exists and is directory before scanning.

```mojo
var root = Path(path_str)
if not root.exists():
    print("Error: Path does not exist: " + path_str, file=stderr)
    return
if not root.is_dir():
    print("Error: Path is not a directory: " + path_str, file=stderr)
    return
```

**Location:** cli.mojo:32

title: Detect Python version dynamically
description:
**Problem:** reranker.mojo:22-31 has hardcoded Python versions (3.11, 3.12, 3.13). Will break when Python 3.14 ships.

```mojo
py_versions.append("3.13")
py_versions.append("3.12")
py_versions.append("3.11")
```

**Solution:** Detect Python version from sys.version_info.

```mojo
var sys = Python.import_module("sys")
var major = Int(sys.version_info.major)
var minor = Int(sys.version_info.minor)
var site = current_dir + "/.pixi/envs/default/lib/python" + String(major) + "." + String(minor) + "/site-packages"
```

**Location:** src/inference/reranker.mojo:22-31
close_reason: Fixed: now uses sys.version_info for dynamic detection

title: Add --top-k flag
description:
**Problem:** Results limited to hardcoded 10. Users may want more or fewer.

**Solution:** Add --top-k N flag to control result count.

```mojo
# Arg parsing
if arg.startswith("--top-k="):
    top_k = Int(arg[8:])
elif arg == "--top-k":
    # Next arg is the value
    ...
```

**Locations:**
- cli.mojo: Parse --top-k flag
- bridge.py: Pass top_k to search()
